title: Create an expense line manually
content:
Every entity that is subject to financial management in ESM (cost center, device, etc.) has a Credit balance that is calculated based on the Expense Lines that apply to it. 

Expense lines can be generated automatically by predefined cost allocation rules, you can also create expense lines manually if needed.

To create an expense line, you must first create the following financial metadata: 

  • A fiscal year. For details, see Create a fiscal year record.
  • An accounting period. For details, see Create an accounting period record. 
  • A cost center. For details, see Create a cost center record.
  • A cost type. For details, see Create a cost type record.

  1. From the main menu, select Run > Financials > Expense line. The Expense Line page is displayed.

  2. Click  New.

  3. In the New Expense line dialog box, provide all requested information. This dialog box requests values for the basic attributes.

    Field Description

    Display label

    		 External (common) name of the expense line.

    Amount

    Amount of the expense line.

    Currency

    The currency used for this expense line.
    Cost center The business unit to which the expense line belongs.
    Cost type The type of cost. For example, hardware maintenance or software.
    Credit/Debit Specify if the expense line is credit or debit. An expense line with a credit amount increases the balance for the corresponding cost center, and a debit amount decreases the balance for the corresponding cost center. 
    Expense date Specify a date that the expense is incurred. The date can only be equal to or greater than the current date.

    If you want to create an expense line for a specific record, specify the parent type and parent ID. The following parent types are supported by default:

    • Subscription

    • Contract

    • Device

    • License

    • Infrastructure & Peripheral

    The tenant admin can add more record types to the support list in a Dev tenant. Make sure the following fields are available on these record types:

    • Amount
    • Currency
    • Cost center
    • Cost type

    After additional record types are added to CostAllocationRuleEntityType list, define the list for expense allocation and chargeback allocation respectively.

    1. From the main menu, select Administration > Configuration > Lists.

    2. In the Lists pane on the left, select CostAllocationRuleEntityType.

    3. In the right pane, click + Add, enter the record type name and display name, click OK.

    4. Click Save.

    1. From the main menu, select Administration > Configuration > Studio > Processes and Rules.
    2. Select Cost allocation from the drop-down box at the top of the screen and select the Processes and Rules tab.
    3. Expand Rendering forms on the right, locate the Define suggested values for... process event, edit the values for expense allocation and chargeback allocation as needed.

  4. Click Save.

    Alternatively, you can click Save & add another to add another expense line, or click Save & Edit to continue editing the current cost allocation rule.
